botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Ingestion may cause severe discomfort. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Passiflora are mostly tender tendril-climbing shrubs, with simple or palmately-lobed, generally evergreen leaves and showy flowers of distinctive structure with often colourful coronal filaments, followed by conspicuous fruits, edible in some species

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow under glass in a greenhouse border or large container, in loam-based potting compost, in full light with shade from hot sun. In frost free areas, grow outdoors in moderately fertile, moist but well-drained soil in full sun or partial shade, with shelter from cold, drying winds
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed, by semi-hardwood cuttings in summer, or by layering in spring or autumn
how_to_grow.pruning: Pruning group 11 or 12, if necessary, in early spring
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to red spider mites, glasshouse whitefly, mealybugs and scale insects under glass
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to virus diseases, including cucumber mosaic virus
